** Carnage was not surprised as she watched both Teltoli and Instrat get 
into another argument as well as another battle.
She had to admit, this was rather interesting, and her laughter her ceased 
once Instrat had stepped aside and got irate about it. But all she had 
really come for was her meal, and she still had a boar to finish off a mile 
and a bit north from their current location.
Carnage watched the two fight with lessening amusement until she finally 
shrugged and converted back into beast mode, walking over to the fallen sow 
and standing over the bloodied carcass.
By now the sow had bled to death instead of letting her finish it off 
quickly, it was rather an unintended ending. But it couldn�t be helped now.
Carnage turned her head and looked over at the two fighting bots, wondering 
if she really should stay, but decided that she didn�t have to.
Besides, those two weren�t fighting for any real reason, just because 
tempers were running high and they were taking it out on each other.
Carnage looked at Teltoli with a blank expression on her face. **
� You can stay here and fight meaninglessly if you want, but I have what I 
came here for. And I�m leaving.�

** Carnage simply then turned away from the two, bent down and picked up her 
kill in her jaws, finding it rather heavy but manageable.
The sow was large and she had to carry a bit of it in her scaled arms as she 
walked away and into the shadows of the forest, heading off in the direction 
of the distant squeals of the boar. **
� I�m coming!�

** She said with her mouth full, stopping when she came across the headless 
piglet. Wondering if she would be able to pick it up and, somehow, not lose 
the sow onto the ground at the same time.
Carnage finally decided that she would leave it there, maybe come back for 
it once she had the boar killed and the sow nestled safely beside it.
There was no point in wasting fresh meat.
So, she continued on her way deeper into the forest and towards the giant 
trees, where the boar lay in pain at one tree roots. But his pain would be 
over soon.
: The only thing I like to let suffer is a bot.: Carnage thought to herself 
as she went on her way.
Then wondering if she should really let Teltoli take care of Instrat on her 
own. But with the way things were going, Teltoli could take care of herself.
Besides, Carnage had grown a taste for being alone. It was usual now. And 
she didn�t like being around bots for too long anymore. Eventually it would 
lead to wounds, maybe even death. And even though she thought that death 
wouldn�t bee all that bad, she didn�t want to meet the Pit just yet. **
